playn.core

Interface Events.Position

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Events.Input
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Mouse.ButtonEvent, Mouse.MotionEvent, Mouse.WheelEvent, Pointer.Event, Touch.Event
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Events.Position.Impl, Mouse.ButtonEvent.Impl, Mouse.MotionEvent.Impl, Mouse.WheelEvent.Impl, Pointer.Event.Impl, Touch.Event.Impl
    Enclosing class:
    Events

    public static interface Events.Position
extends Events.Input
    The base for all events with a screen position.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Events.Position.Impl 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Layer hit()
      The layer that was hit when generating this event, or null if the event is currently being processed by the global listener.
      float localX()
      The x-coordinate associated with this event transformed into the receiving layer's coordinate system.
      float localY()
      The y-coordinate associated with this event transformed into the receiving layer's coordinate system.
      float x()
      The screen x-coordinate associated with this event.
      float y()
      The screen y-coordinate associated with this event.

      • Methods inherited from interface playn.core.Events.Input

        capture, flags, time

    • Method Detail

      • x

        float x()
        The screen x-coordinate associated with this event.

      • y

        float y()
        The screen y-coordinate associated with this event.

      • localX

        float localX()
        The x-coordinate associated with this event transformed into the receiving layer's coordinate system. See Layer.addListener(playn.core.Pointer.Listener), etc.

      • localY

        float localY()
        The y-coordinate associated with this event transformed into the receiving layer's coordinate system. See Layer.addListener(playn.core.Pointer.Listener), etc.

      • hit

        Layer hit()
        The layer that was hit when generating this event, or null if the event is currently being processed by the global listener.
